lender.name: Mark
lender.loan_because: People who have achieved financial success have not done so on their own; someone has invested in them by lending money or by lending a hand. That is what Kiva is about: directly investing in good people and in their communities. I enjoy being part of that. Another reason to lend: we are commanded to love our neighbors. Kiva gives us a great way to be faithful to that commandment.

lender.name: Aaron and Katie
lender.loan_because: God\'s given us resources so we\'d like to use some of our resources to help other people out. Also, Aaron started his own business a few years ago, so we can identify with people who are starting and/or expanding their own business. Plus it\'s a great way to connect with people around the world!
lender.occupational_info: Katie works at the front desk of a medical clinic doing scheduling, billing, answering phones, etc. Aaron runs an internet based music equipment store.

lender.name: Jessica
lender.loan_because: I care.
lender.occupational_info: My work is an extension of me. Therefore, it is always changing and is never done. I see the things in this world that move me, and I try to capture them as honestly as I can.

lender.name: Richard
lender.loan_because: Give a man a fish and he will eat today - lend a man the money for a fishing boat and he will feed a village for a lifetime.
lender.occupational_info: I assist heart doctors in diagnosing and treating heart disease before or during a heart attack.

lender.name: Pat & Jack
lender.loan_because: Improving lives and conditions around the world improves our own lives.
lender.occupational_info: Work with secondary grade students and special education.

lender.name: Dionne
lender.loan_because: Life has dealt me a great hand...it's about time I return the favor

lender.name: Erin
lender.loan_because: As a constantly traveling consultant, I know how small the world really is. It takes a village (albeit, a very global one) and I am grateful to be a part of it.
lender.occupational_info: I help companies meet their business objectives through computing technologies.

lender.name: Alex
lender.loan_because: people should be given the opportunity to accomplish their goals through hard work.
lender.occupational_info: I use computer programs to analyze and draw conclusions from data.

lender.name: Susan
lender.loan_because: I want to empower women around the world.

lender.name: Steve & Denise
lender.loan_because: We have a great amount of respect for bootstrap entrepreneurs. KIVA gives us an unprecedented opportunity to lend to remarkable people. We are very excited to be a small part of their future success!
lender.occupational_info: Steve manages investments for individuals and organizations. Denise practices Jin Shin Jyutsu - a form of healing therapy - with individuals and animals.

lender.name: Franco
lender.loan_because: God has blessed me and I would like to be able to share that blessing with others.
lender.occupational_info: Teacher of the Handicapped.

lender.name: Dawn
lender.loan_because: Everyone deserves a chance.
lender.occupational_info: I work in transportation for the public sector. I make sure the community where a project is being built is able to talk about what they like or don\'t like. This way the final project considers everyone\'s needs.

lender.name: Beth and Brian
lender.loan_because: A little from me is a lot to another.

lender.name: Chris
lender.loan_because: I want to help others.

lender.name: Tim
lender.loan_because: It's a great way to help proactive and innovative people change the way they live.

lender.name: Nick
lender.loan_because: It is the right thing to do...

lender.name: Rachel
lender.loan_because: The idea of giving people a hand up instead of a hand out is very exciting. Forget leaving it to governments to fix the world's problems. This program puts the money directly in the hands of the people in need and gives them an opportunity to be self-sufficient. The best part is, unlike charity, this money gets recycled over and over again and has the potential to change many people's lives. A big thanks to Frontline for getting the word out!

lender.name: Peter
lender.loan_because: It is a good chance to give a chance

lender.name: Hugh
lender.loan_because: It is the right thing to do. I feel that if I can help others better themselves then I am helping to build a more peaceful world. I want my children to live in a better world, and by lending I can help others to give their families a chance a better life.
lender.occupational_info: I am a fire protection loss prevention specialist working for a large property and business insurance company. I inspect large manufacturing facilities to help identify and reduce potential losses from fire, flood, electrical breakdown, flammable and combustible liquids hazards and other types of hazards.

lender.name: Dean
lender.loan_because: Being self-employed I understand the challenges in starting up a business of one\'s own. Since I am doing reasonably well I would like to help others become self-sufficient.
lender.occupational_info: I work with people in their homes improving their fitness levels and helping them recover from injuries. My clientele are mostly seniors.

lender.name: Karen
lender.loan_because: This is something I can do to make a difference today.
lender.occupational_info: I assist vulnerable adults in living independently.

lender.name: Addi
lender.occupational_info: Create websites and help folks out with their computers

lender.name: Steven

lender.occupational_info: I am retired and living overseas shortly. I like mystery novels, history, and cooking, so that is my work now, I read and eat!

lender.name: Bob Lurie

lender.name: Luke and Kelly

lender.name: Jee

lender.occupational_info: *shrug*

lender.name: R & D
lender.loan_because: Everyone deserves a fair chance.

lender.name: Ben
lender.loan_because:
Years ago, when I first heard of and understood what Muhammad Yunus was up to with microfinance in Bangladesh, I felt a kind of lightning bolt of excitement: microfinance is so brilliant and powerful because it actually bridges that gap between 'first-world' wealth and 'third-world' needs. It makes the numbers work, it's pragmatic and it's sustainable. For decades weve seen the ads on TV late at night, about how for 'pennies a day' we could feed an African orphan, and yet that fact hasnt changed cycles of poverty. Yunuss microloans have and the process can be replicatedand is being replicatedin other devloping countries.
When I heard about Kiva and realized that I could take part, it was like another quantum leap in global connectivity. I'm so excited about this program and really proud to be part of it.
lender.occupational_info: I write stories which we turn into films and sometimes they\'re funny.

lender.name: Harry
lender.loan_because:
I am fortunate enough to live in the United States, and live a comfortable life. I would like to give back something to help those in other parts of the world. Kiva is a great organization that I truly believe makes our world a better place to live in.
I am particularly interested in helping entrepreneurs in Cambodia. I have never been to that country, but have many friends that are of Cambodian decent. I am glad to see that country progress after such a troubling past, and I am glad to be able to contribute to the country's success, albeit in a small way.

lender.name: Arbita

lender.occupational_info:
Our mission is to deliver the business and systems environments required for the free and efficient flow of opportunity and talent beyond borders. We work for the future.

Arbita delivers a world of opportunity through our matrix of relationships. 

In complex markets and technology environments real-world solutions require cooperation, innovation and expertise.

We connect people and companies around the globe through social engineering and technical integrations augmented by world-class service. 

We help our clients navigate the ever-changing global employment marketplace through technology, netweaving and transformational leadership.
